messageBody:
Actually, I wasn't meaning asserts outside your tests. I meant in your
failing test, before and after the invocation of the Class Under Test.
However, use whatever works - and the assert approach may not work at all.

Also, I'll mention another idea, although it may be anathema to this
list. If you can somehow DETECT the failure, put a breakpoint in your
application (System.in or something to that effect), and then fire up
your debugger and inspect the state of everything.

I know that many people on this list (and Dave Astel's in his fine book)
say you shouldn't need the debugger if you TDD intensively enough. I
myself am unfortunately not to that level yet, and I often find it
useful to fire up the debugger.

Whatever approach you use, I think the general idea is to gradually
narrow down the scope of the unknown failure until you can see what is
the root cause.

Hope this helps,
Chad
